pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:0.5: 30. The training rule on sitting in private
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.2: At that time the former wife of Venerable Udāyī had been given the full ordination as a nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.3: She often went to see Udāyī, and he often went to see her.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.4: And on one occasion Udāyī was seated in private alone with that nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.5: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.6: “How can Venerable Udāyī sit in private alone with a nun?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.7: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.10: “… Foolish man, how can you sit in private alone with a nun?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.11: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.12: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.13.1: ‘If a monk sits in private alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.6: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.10: just the monk and the nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.12: there is private to the eye and there is private to the ear.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.14: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.16: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.18: if the monk sits down or lies down next to a seated nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.19: If a nun sits down or lies down next to the seated monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.20: If both are seated or both are lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.1: If it is private, and he perceives it as private, and he sits down alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.2: If it is private, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.3: If it is private, but he perceives it as not private, and he sits down alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.4: If it is not private, but he perceives it as private, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.5: If it is not private, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.6: If it is not private, and he perceives it as not private, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.2: if he has a companion who understands;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.3: if he stands and does not sit down;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.4: if he is not seeking privacy;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.5: if he sits down preoccupied with something else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.8: The tenth rule, the training rule on sitting in private, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.9: The third sub-chapter on the instruction is finished.
